resources.string: On %1$s you will get a notification asking you to answer the same set of questionnaires that you did at the beginning of the study. Once those are answered, you have finished the study!

On %1$s you will get a notification asking you to answer the same set of questionnaires that you did at the beginning of the study. Once those are answered, the study is over and we will give you a completion code! Please submit NOCODE for now.
Uninstall this app at any time to withdraw from the study. Please also call the START clinic to let us know that you have chosen to withdraw.
Return your submission on the Prolific website and then uninstall this app (Logger) to withdraw from the study.
All tasks complete, thank you! You can uninstall the app now.
All tasks complete, thank you! You can uninstall the app after submitting your completion code or clicking the completion URL below.

This questionnaire will ask you 5 questions about how your mental health may be affecting your daily activities. Touch and drag on the following scales to rate each question.

  0 : Not at all
1-3: Mildly
4-6: Moderately
7-9: Markedly
 10: Extremely
Your mental health has disrupted your work/school work:
I have not worked/studied at all during the past week for reasons unrelated to the disorder.
* Work includes paid, unpaid volunteer work or training
Your mental health has disrupted your social life/leisure activities:
Your mental health has disrupted your family life/home responsibilities:
On how many days in the last week did your mental health cause you to miss school or work or leave you unable to carry out your normal daily responsibilities?
On how many days in the last week did you feel so impaired by your mental health, that even though you went to school or work, your productivity was reduced?

This questionnaire assesses the way that social anxiety may play a role in your life across a variety of situations. Please read each situation carefully and answer two questions about that situation.

The first question asks how anxious or fearful you feel in the situation.The second question asks how often you avoid the situation.

If you come across a situation that you ordinarily do not experience, imagine "what if you were faced with that situation," and then, rate the degree to which you would fear this situation and how often you would tend to avoid it.

Please base your ratings on the way that the situations have affected you in the last two weeks.

string-array.name: lsas_questions_array
string-array.item: Telephoning in public
Participating in small groups
Eating in public places
Drinking with others in public places
Talking to people in authority
Acting, performing or giving a talk in front of an audience
Going to a party
Working while being observed
Writing while being observed
Calling someone you don\'t know very well
Talking with people you don\'t know very well
Meeting strangers
Urinating in a public bathroom
Entering a room when others are already seated
Being the center of attention
Speaking up at a meeting
Taking a written test
Expressing appropriate disagreement or disapproval to people you don\'t know very well
Looking at people you don\'t know very well in the eyes
Giving a report to a group
Trying to pick up someone
Returning goods to a store where returns are normally accepted
Giving an average party
Resisting a high pressure salesperson

string-array.name: lsas_examples_array
string-array.item: • speaking on the telephone in a public place
• having a discussion with a few others
• do you tremble or feel awkward handling food
• refers to any beverage including alcohol
• for example, a boss or teacher
• refers to a large audience
• an average party to which you may be invited; assume you know some but not all of the people at the party
• any type of work you might do including school work or housework
• for example, signing a check in a bank
• assume that others are sometimes present as might normally be expected
• refers to a small group, and nobody has to move seats for you
• telling a story to a group of people
• speaking from your seat in a small meeting or standing up in place in a large meeting
• refers to appropriate eye contact
• refers to an oral presentation to a small group
• refers to a single person attempting to initiate a relationship with a stranger
• avoidance refers to listening to a salesperson too long

resources.string: Fear or Anxiety in this situation
Avoidance (how often would you avoid this situation)
This questionnaire will ask you 7 more questions related to feelings of worry or anxiety over the past 2 weeks.

string-array.name: gad7_questions_array
string-array.item: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you felt nervous, anxious, or on edge?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been unable to stop or control worrying?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been worrying too much about different things?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble relaxing?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you been so restless that it\'s hard to sit still?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you become easily annoyed or irritable?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you felt afraid as if something awful might happen?

resources.string: This questionnaire will ask you 9 more questions related to your mood over the past 2 weeks.

string-array.name: phq9_questions_array
string-array.item: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you felt down, depressed or hopeless?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had felt tired or having little energy?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you either had poor appetite or were overeating?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you felt bad about yourself - or that you\'re a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?

Over the past 2 weeks, how often were you moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or, the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way?

resources.string: This questionnaire will ask you 8 more questions related to your mood over the past 2 weeks.

string-array.name: phq8_questions_array
string-array.item: Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had little interest or pleasure in doing things?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you felt down, depressed or hopeless?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or sleeping too much?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had felt tired or having little energy?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you either had poor appetite or were overeating?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you felt bad about yourself - or that you\'re a failure or have let yourself or your family down?
Over the past 2 weeks, how often have you had trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television?

Over the past 2 weeks, how often were you moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed. Or, the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual?
